strlcpy.c

00001 /*      $NetBSD: strlcpy.c,v 1.14 2003/10/27 00:12:42 lukem Exp $       */
00002 /*      $OpenBSD: strlcpy.c,v 1.7 2003/04/12 21:56:39 millert Exp $     */
00003

00019 #include <u/missing/strlcpy.h>
00020 
00021 #ifndef HAVE_STRLCPY
00022 /*
00023  * Copy src to string dst of size siz.  At most siz-1 characters
00024  * will be copied.  Always NUL terminates (unless siz == 0).
00025  * Returns strlen(src); if retval >= siz, truncation occurred.
00026  */
00027 size_t strlcpy(char *dst, const char *src, size_t siz)
00028 {
00029         char *d = dst;
00030         const char *s = src;
00031         size_t n = siz;
00032 
00033         /* Copy as many bytes as will fit */
00034         if (n != 0 && --n != 0) {
00035                 do {
00036                         if ((*d++ = *s++) == 0)
00037                                 break;
00038                 } while (--n != 0);
00039         }
00040 
00041         /* Not enough room in dst, add NUL and traverse rest of src */
00042         if (n == 0) {
00043                 if (siz != 0)
00044                         *d = '\0';              /* NUL-terminate dst */
00045                 while (*s++)
00046                         ;
00047         }
00048 
00049         return(s - src - 1);    /* count does not include NUL */
00050 }
00051 #else   /* HAVE_STRLCPY */
00052 size_t strlcpy (char *, const char *, size_t);
00053 #endif  /* !HAVE_STRLCPY */
